titleStmt.title: Another fight between the two armies of Scotch and English, upon an attempt to take Appleby Castle. More Scots come in from Carlisle and Barwick. And the relieving of Major Generall Lambert by Yorkeshire. Prince Charleses ship taken by Sir Michael Livesey. Captaine Green taken prisoner. All the ordnance and ammunition taken at Marget, neere Sandwich. And a great fight at the storming of Colchester at the mill. With the particulars of the fight. With the copy of a declaration shot into Colchester, by order from the Lord Generall Fairfax.
titleStmt.author: Fairfax, Thomas Fairfax, Baron, 1612-1671.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for the generall sataisfaction of moderate men,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

person.persName: the generall sataisfaction of moderate men
